I'm Anh. I am currently a Ph.D. student in the [Department of Statistics](https://stat.wisc.edu/){target="_blank"} at the University of Wisconsin, Madison.

## Working on

- teaching introductory statistics
- [missing data in surrogate validation](pages/research/missing-surrogate/index.qmd)
- learning C++
- gardening ([Masanobu Fukuoka's one straw revolution](https://www.chelseagreen.com/product/one-straw-revolutionary/?srsltid=AfmBOopGKc-v5EauW7klSkUZBagZTdahJ7E_ckw85G3GE_bYoylJ4R53))

## Previously

Before that I was a M.S. student and taught as a Visisting Assistant Professor in the [Department of Statistics](https://stats.wfu.edu/){target="_blank"} at Wake Forest University. There I worked with [Dr. Sarah Lotspeich](https://www.sarahlotspeich.com/){target="_blank"} on correcting for missing data for surrogate validation in a clinical setting. I was a math major at [Smith College](https://www.smith.edu/){target="_blank"}  with a minor in Statistics and Data Science.
